title: Makeup-free Laura Byrne dotes over baby daughter Marlie-Mae at a cafe in Sydney
text:
The Bachelor's Laura Byrne and Matty Johnson have just returned from their first overseas holiday with baby daughter Marlie Mae.

And after their trip to London, the mother-daughter duo were seen soaking up the sunshine in Sydney's Rushcutters Bay on Saturday.

Laura, 32, was dressed casually in activewear as she met friends for coffee at a local café.

Mummy and me! A makeup-free Laura Byrne doted over her baby daughter Marlie Mae while catching up with friends at a café in Rushcutters Bay, Sydney on Saturday

The friends ordered coffee and juice as they took turns holding Laura's little girl.

Laura was seen smiling and clapping energetically at Marlie Mae as one of her friends leant over the table to return the child to her arms.

The youngster was dressed in a white onesie, with a rabbit face printed on the front.

All smiles! Laura was seen clapping energetically at Marlie Mae as one of her friends leant over the table to return the child to her arms

Keeping it casual: Laura, 32, was dressed in her activewear as she met with friends for coffee

Meanwhile, Laura looked slim in a pair of black leggings and a white singlet.

The new mother appeared to go makeup-free for the outing, and placed her brunette locks up into a messy bun.

She shielded her fair complexion from the sun with a black cap and sunglasses.

Adorable: The youngster was dressed in a white onesie, with a rabbit face printed on the front

Laura was seen pushing Marlie Mae around the walking paths in her stroller.

The jewellery designer used to frequent the area with her three-legged dog Buster, as she once lived nearby before moving into a Bondi apartment with Matty.

Her studio and store for label ToniMay is now a 25-minute walk from the bay on Paddington's Oxford Street.

Where's Buster? The jewellery designer used to frequent the area with her three-legged dog Buster, as she once lived nearby before moving into a Bondi apartment with Matty

Natural beauty: The new mother appeared to go makeup-free for the outing, and placed her brunette locks up into a messy bun

Girls' day out! Laura was seen pushing Marlie Mae around the walking paths in her stroller

Last month, Laura told WHO magazine that she and Matty 'definitely' want more children in the future.

But they said they aren't in a rush to expand their family until after their wedding next year.

'We keep saying we definitely want to have more than one baby. I'm not rushing into doing it tomorrow, but we would love another kid,' she told the magazine.

The pair's love story famously began when Matty chose Laura as the winner of The Bachelor in 2017. They confirmed their engagement in April this year.
description: The Bachelor's Laura Byrne and Matty Johnson have just returned from their first overseas holiday with baby daughter Marlie Mae.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
